intro: Ardisia nigrescens subsp. donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Donnell-Smith ardisia, is a species native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Botanically, it belongs to the family Ericaceae and is distinguished by its unique subspecies traits, including its leaf morphology and flowering patterns. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of primary forests.
